name: Atrium Palace Thalasso Spa Resort & Villas

reviews.text: Thanks for looking at this review. As an overview, we are a middle aged couple who travel with no kids, generally looking for a decent standard of holiday.
reviews.title: Great Location for Lindos

likes.disliked: — Probably the high number of kids !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were staying at the Atrium as part of a package to see an annual Rock concert based in Lindos, Rhodes. BTW that is great !!!
reviews.title: Lovely weather, slightly disappointed in hotel

likes.disliked: — Hard bed, tired and dated furnishings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrival in Rhodes was superb and we decided to pick up a car at the airport on arrival, no problems and we had a VW polo through Holiday Autos at £130 for the week. The trip to the hotel is easy, about 45 mins on main roads (no pun intended !!), head to Lindon and about 5Km from Lindos a sign in the village of Kalathos points in the diection of the hotel.
reviews.title: Hotel was nice but some annoying bits

reviews.text: The hotel is based in the small village of Kalathos, about 5Km or £5 taxi ride from Lindos. I think it is probably worth the small taxi fare to have the benefit of a luxury hotel. Around the hotel are a few smashing places to eat, as well as a few bars and a lovely beach with all the facailities you would expect.
reviews.title: Love the Atrium Palace

reviews.text: The hotel is a very good standard. It is a 5 star hotel, probably a little generous in my view, but still a very good standard. We stayed in a side sea view ground floor room in the "new block". It was very adequate (based on a 5* hotel). Our room had TV with about 3 english programmes, hairdryer and mini bar. Room service was excellent, the breakfast a couple of quid extra but very well worth it.
reviews.title: Satisfied in every aspect

reviews.text: We booked the Atrium Palace through Sovereign and so we expected something quite special. In the end, while there was absolutely nothing to complain about, the hotel somehow didn't have that special 'something' that we expected for the price we paid.
reviews.title: Good but not Exceptional

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel's strong points were the service (particularly in the restaurant) and some of the facilities such as the pool bar and good well-stocked hotel shop. Everywhere was very clean and the maid service was efficient and left our room in perfect condition every day.
reviews.title: Best place in Greece

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was very little that wasn't up to scratch. The in-room air conditioning was not very efficient and had to be left on 24 hours/day to make any impression on the room temperature (not very eco-friendly).
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel – and an Earthquake thrown in for free

likes.liked: — The gorgeous surroundings and the pool scene
likes.disliked: — The entertainment but there's a good bar opposite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only real disappointment was the food in the main restaurant. We booked half board (we don't often do that as we like to eat in local restaurants) and in this case it wasn't the best decision. While the buffet selection always included lots of fresh produce, with good salads and fruits, and there was a fair selection, the overall feel of the food was a bit like school dinners. Food was often over-cooked and had a very "mass-produced" feel.
reviews.title: Loved every minute of our stay.

likes.liked: — spacous, Very well decorated with murals, clean and original.
likes.disliked: — small tv , not that we watched much of it anyway!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In contrast to this, the food in the a la carte restaurant by the beach was excellent, complimented by a lovely setting.
reviews.title: Greek hospitality at its best !

likes.liked: — Excellent facilities, food and friendliness of staff

reviews.text: This hotel was sold to us by Thomas Cook as 5 Star which by usual International standards it clearly isn't. That said, it is by local standards of high quality.
reviews.title: Nice hotel - but not 5 star

reviews.text: There were some issues with cleanliness and bedding was only changed every 2 or 3 days. The mattresses were very hard and a double bed consists of two singles put together. The sheets were not the usual quality starched linen you would expect. They had a strange rubber coating feel about them and the beds were made with almost military efficiency. Our rooms were in a recently refurbished part of the hotel, yet there was mould around the edges of the bath. The bathrooms had no shaving socket or shaving mirror. The sun loungers around the pool were a bit shabby and had obviously seen better days. the water in the pool seemed a bit cloudy and algae and dirt was left under the grills around the edge. One of our party picked up an ear infection from the pool.
reviews.title: lovely hotel but in th middle of nowhere

reviews.text: On the subject of the pool, it's not heated as a previous review mentioned, but with daytime temperatures approaching 40C in mid-August you really don't need heated water in the pool.
reviews.title: great venue for a wedding!

likes.disliked: — No tea/coffee making facilities in rooms

reviews.text: We booked two rooms and asked for adjacent rooms at the time of booking several months ago. We were allocated two rooms in the same part of the complex but well away from each other. We complained about this but nothing was done.
reviews.title: Excellent good relaxing hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To start with, the hotel was very disappointing but within a couple of days we had settled in and began to relax. There was an ant infestation in one of the rooms and the air conditioning failed. Both issues were dealt with quickly and efficiently. The food was a reasonable quality and there was plenty of choice but the main restaurant had more of a canteen feel about it. You are allocated a table at the start of your stay and changing table could be difficult. I get the impression that the kitchens and food handling were of a high standard. No one appeared to suffer illnesses from the food. Order all your drinks at the start of the meal. We made the mistake of ordering a bottle of water half way through. After 20 minutes and asking staff three times where the drink was it finally arrived. We were finished with the meal by then and didn't really want it anymore.
reviews.title: Nice holiday!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having seen some of the reviews regarding this hotel I totally agree with previous comments that this is not 5 star.
reviews.title: five star public areas but not the rooms

likes.liked: — The selaction of pools and outdoor areas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The outdoor public areas are beautiful, spacious, spotlessly clean, more than enough sun beds for everyone. The staff are mostly extremely helpful and friendly, especially our maids and breakfast waitress.
reviews.title: A tropical paradise with a couple of buts

likes.liked: — the beautiful views throughout day and night
likes.disliked: — too many stray cats for a cat lover

reviews.text: The rooms however, (we had a standard side sea view) are NOT 5 star. Bedroom area a good size, plenty of wardrobe and storage space. Nice little balcony just large enough for two. The bathroom was however appalling. They had squeezed a small bath with a shower above which was so small that my husband could not fit his feet to stand sideways! We had no shower curtain, which we know is usual in Greece, but in a 5 start hotel I would expect a curtain, or preferably just a shower cubical. The decor was OK but poorly finished.
reviews.title: Definitely not 5 Star

likes.disliked: — Lack of customer service and consideration by staff

reviews.text: We stayed on a b&b basis and are glad we did as we heard nothing but complaints about the food. It was repetative and COLD.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel
Great hotel
reviews.text: The location is OK, beach boring, dark grey/black shingle and stone, with little to look at.

aka: Atrium Palace Thalasso Spa Resort & Villas Hotel Lindos
description: The quality renowned, Atrium Palace Thalasso Spa Resort & Villas is the ideal destination for marvelous vacations and relaxing holidays. This architecturally innovative hotel combines luxury with its delightful blend of Greek Classical styles and ambiance meters from the crystal clear beach. The hotel is situated in the tranquil bay of Kalathos, close to the picturesque village of Lindos, on the Southeast area of Rhodes Island. Its unique beauties of nature and cultural heritage characterize it as the most intriguing region of the island.
